title: Associate Director/Principal Data Scientist, Trial Acceleration Analytics (On-Site, Illinois Based)
required_experience:

description:
Purpose: Data Science and Analytics is an ambitious team of Data Scientists and Data Engineers with a unique blend of Business, Scientific, and Machine Learning expertise that seeks to unleash the full potential of AbbVie’s data assets by bringing technology and/or data and insights to the forefront of decision making via fit-for-purpose solutions.

The Principal Data Scientist, Trial Acceleration Analytics is a key technical leadership role to enable application of advanced analytics techniques across clinical development continuum. Drives Analytics innovation and experimentation to enable data-driven insights for complex business problems across R&D by deploying advanced analytics techniques. Identifies and leads use cases that are appropriate for the application of Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence. Stays abreast of industry trends and identifies new opportunities and value propositions.

Roles and Responsibilities:
• Partner with cross-functional teams to identify new opportunities requiring the use of modern analytical and modeling techniques; Lead the design, analysis, and interpretation of projects from data requirement gathering to data processing, modeling, and recommendations
• Build production ready advanced analytics solutions to drive effective business and scientific decisions
• Drive the definition, design, implementation and validation of cutting-edge algorithms to analyze disparate data sources to achieve targeted outcomes by leveraging machine learning and Artificial Intelligence approaches, predictive and statistical modeling concepts, clustering and classification techniques
• Design experiments to test hypothesis across the business areas in clinical development continuum
• Own the full lifecycle of model development from ideation and data exploration, algorithm design and testing, algorithm development and deployment, to algorithm monitoring and tuning in production.
• Ensures adherence to federal regulations and applicable local regulations, Good Clinical Practices (GCPs), ICH Guidelines, AbbVie Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), and to functional quality standards. Stays abreast of new and/or evolving local regulations, guidelines and policies related to clinical development
• Innovate with new approaches, staying abreast of current research in the recommendations field and the broader machine-learning community. Shares technical solutions and product ideas with the team through robust documentations and effective presentations
• Responsible for coaching and mentoring junior team members. May include indirect supervision of employee and contract staff
• Collaborates across R&D functional areas to link data and key learnings for broad impact on complex, cross-functional projects involving multiple scientific and/or clinical discipline and Advanced Analytics methodologies. Capable of translating complex data science findings to broad audiences (both technical & non-technical)
• This position will be required to sit on-site 3 days / week*

Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree statistics, analytics, bioinformatics, mathematics, data science or equivalent field. Master’s degree preferred
• 8+ years of experience building, evaluating and deploying machine learning models or other advanced analytics capabilities at scale
• Expert in the field / Principal Advisor level proficiency in R, Python or other statistical packages. Expert-level knowledge of statistical and data mining techniques. Expert-level proficiency in the application of machine learning and artificial intelligence
• Experience with visualization tools like Spotfire, Tableau or equivalent
• Proven expertise with Machine Learning and other advanced analytics techniques
• Demonstrated effective communication skills. Demonstrated ability to communicate analytical and technical concepts in layman’s terms
• History of coming up with innovative and creative quantitative solutions and data-driven product changes proven through practical business impact and/or publications.
• Demonstrated history of successful execution in a fast-paced environment and in managing multiple priorities effectively
• Experience working in Cloud Computing environments (e.g., AWS, Azure, etc) is preferred
• Prior experience with application of AI/ML within clinical development is preferred
• Proven leadership traits with ability to lead and inspire staff, and to influence others without direct authority.

AbbVie is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives, serving our community, and embracing diversity and inclusion. It is AbbVie’s policy to employ qualified persons of the greatest ability without discrimination against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy), physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, status as a protected veteran, or any other legally protected group status.
